title: Settings for the trigger engine.
description: Configures options for various system-level controls.

awaitWriteFinish.description: Waits for writes to finish before analyzing images. This is useful if the images live on a network drive that's mounted to Docker, but comes with a performance penalty. Disabled by default.

enableAnnotations.description: Enables generation of annotated images. Disabled by default.

deepstackUri.description: The address of the Deepstack AI processing server.

port.description: The port the local web server attaches to. Only used when enableAnnotations is true, and also requires the port be exposed in the Docker configuration.

processExistingImages.description: Enables processing of images that exist in the input folder at startup. Primarily useful during development. Disabled by default.

purgeAge.description: Sets the time, in minutes, an image can go without being accessed before it is purged from local storage. Only used when enableAnnotations is true.

purgeInterval.description: Sets the frequency, in minutes, that the purge process runs. Only used when enableAnnotations is true.

telegram.description: Enables and configures Telegram bot messages.
